intro: Echinopsis ferox var. potosina, commonly known as the Potosí cactus, is a species native to northern Argentina and southern Bolivia. It is a columnar cactus with a ribbed stem and produces large, showy white or pink flowers during the cooler months. The plant has a spiny exterior, with prominent areoles that bear both spines and flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for succulent gardens. Due to its striking appearance and hardy nature, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
